title: 2026 French municipal elections: The right and far right remain mostly divided
subhead: Despite some local elected officials coming closer together and an increasingly volatile electorate, there have been no mass movements from the right toward the far-right Rassemblement National ahead of the March 15 and 22 elections.

title: US ambassador's highly undiplomatic remarks spark controversy in Poland
subhead: The US ambassador in Warsaw, Thomas Rose, has decided to cut all contact with the president of Poland's lower house, after the latter spoke out against awarding the Nobel Peace Prize to Donald Trump.

title: 'By sacrificing American soft power, Trump is exacerbating his country's unpopularity and prompting Europeans to exercise their own'
subhead: Distrust toward the US continues to grow, even among its closest allies. The American president's hardline approach could encourage Europe to promote its values, freedoms and way of life, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: Why are major powers competing for control of the Arctic?

title: How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between
